LV

EN

Data-driven

decision making

and automation

with R

Ability to extract value from business data is crucial in any competitive environment. However, the variety, volume and velocity at which data is being generated in 2020 may limit or block these attempts. In 3 days learn how to employ R programming language, RStudio, statistics and the elements of machine learning to automate data analysis and arrive at data-driven decisions that benefit your business.

You will learn:

Practical information:

How to avoid being fooled by randomness.

3-day in-person course.

Size of group: maximum of 10 persons.

Price: 400 EUR per person.

Place: Riga, the House of Science in the University of Latvia Academic Centre or another place depending on availability.

Language of instruction: English, Latvian or Russian, depending on the group.

Prerequisites: experience in analysing high volumes of data in Excel or any other tool. Prior experience in programming is an advantage, but not essential.

 

How to conduct and analyse online controlled experiments (also known as A/B testing) that allow you to establish a causal relationship.

How to automate data gathering from online sources about your competitors’ products.

How to automate complex analysis from data import to presentation of results in visually compelling PDF and HTML reports that contain code, results and your narrative.

How to use clustering for segmenting products into groups that share similar characteristics and simplify the selection process for your customers.

Book now

How to optimize budget spending by predicting customer behaviour.

I am Dmitrijs Kass, the head of data science at Creamfinance, a company with data-driven decisions at the core of its values. I am passionate about data science, enjoy sharing my practical experience and explaining complex concepts in simple ways that aid understanding and long-term retention of ideas. I am also a regular instructor for data analysis with R programming language at the Physics, Mathematics and Optometry faculty of Latvian University and, recently, at Riga Business School. I have also battle-tested the course on data analysis and visualization with R on 150+ business representatives and earned honourable reviews.

How to visualize large volumes of data and explore it with simple yet powerful statistical techniques.

How to optimize investment decisions using diversification.
